result.execSummary:
Bradley James Kober was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Bradley James Kober was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bradley James Kober

defendant.name: Kober, Bradley James
defendant.address: 34992 State Hwy 27 #7, Prairie Du Chien, WI 53821

records.addlTxt:
2:31 PM Case called - appearances stated. 
Defendant Bradley James Kober in court, in custody.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court inquires whether Def. has received a copy of the complaint. Def. states he has received a copy of the complaint and extradition form
Court informs defendant of the nature of the complaint 

Defendant states he wishes to waive extradition
Court reviews waiver of extradition form with defendant. Defendant initials each paragraph on waiver form and signs waiver.

Court finds the waiver was knowingly and voluntarily made, accepts defendant's waiver, and signs order.
